text: Bruno Bérard (born October 28, 1958, in Nancy, France) is a French philosopher, essayist, and metaphysician. He holds a doctorate from the École Pratique des Hautes Études in Religions and Thought Systems and has written extensively on metaphysics, Christian mysticism, and the works of philosopher Jean Borella. == Biography == Bérard is the son of André Bérard (also known as Pamphile), a philosopher, poet laureate of the French Academy, and educator noted for introducing yoga to France. His father was associated with figures such as Jean Borella, Lanza del Vasto, and François Chenique. After growing up in Nancy, Bérard moved to Paris, where he attended Lycée Janson-de-Sailly and later graduated with a degree in commercial studies and a certificate in foreign trade from the Académie Commerciale Internationale. He pursued an international career in the aeronautics industry while teaching at business schools, collaborating with France’s Ministry of Industry, and serving as an expert for the National Agency for Research Promotion (ANVAR). He also volunteered to advise entrepreneurs on business development. === Education === Bérard earned a Diplôme Supérieur d’Études Commerciales and a Certificat Spécial de Commerce Extérieur before enrolling at Paris-Sud University in 1999, where he completed a master’s degree in economics with a focus on globalization. On January 16, 2015, he defended his doctoral thesis, titled “Un philosophe et théologien occultisant au XIXe siècle : la vie et l’œuvre de l’abbé Paul François Gaspard Lacuria (1806–1890)” (“A 19th-Century Occult Philosopher and Theologian: The Life and Work of Abbé Paul François Gaspard Lacuria [1806–1890]”), under the supervision of Jean-Pierre Brach at the École Pratique des Hautes Études. === Career === Bérard began studying metaphysics in 1986 and developed an interest in the works of Jean Borella, with whom he later formed a professional relationship. His writings explore metaphysical themes, Christian mysticism, and Borella’s philosophy. Starting in 2018, his works were translated into English and Italian and featured in publications such as the Corriere Metapolitico. === Editorial Work === After publishing his first books with L’Harmattan in 2005 and 2006, Bérard assisted in relocating the Delphica book series (renamed Théôria) to the publisher. At L’Harmattan, he founded the “Métaphysique au quotidien” (“Metaphysics in Daily Life”) series, which included works by authors such as François Chenique, Jean Borella, and Wolfgang Smith. He also contributed to the journal Politica Hermetica and edited several collaborative volumes, including Qu’est-ce que la métaphysique ? (“What Is Metaphysics?”) and Métaphysique des contes de fées (“Metaphysics of Fairy Tales”). == Main publications == === Works === * A Metaphysics of the Christian Mystery.
